page.title: 07Fairwater Leisure Centre.
page.content: Fairwater Leisure Centre was officially opened on the 8th of February 1985 by Stefan Terlezki, the local M.P. There is a wide range of sports of which the most popular are swimming and badminton. Other activities are bowls, tennis, football, table tennis, volley ball, net ball, and trampolining. About 750 people use the centre per day. The centre costs Â£1.5 million to build and is not finished yet. It employs 18 full time and 20 part time workers. It is owned by Cardiff City Council. There are no membership cards to use the centre, you pay at the door. There is a Cafe and a bar upstairs. The centre is also used for concerts and discos.
